item.title: Blocked Drains Pine Needles - Cheltenham Road B4632, 17th September
item.description:
A concerned resident has requested an update. Tewkesbury Borough Council is investigating the frequency of street sweeping along this section of the road. In addition, the drains in this area need regular unblocking by GCC, as the accumulation of pine needles is preventing proper surface water run-off and causing localised flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wide pothole much larger than dinner plate, 3-4cm deep near drain cover opposite Pickering Close entrance. When buses or heavy vehicles pass, our house (1 Orchard Rd) actually shakes., 17th September
item.description:
Pothole was repaired earlier this year, thank you, but has now reopened and widened. We are on a bus route (W), opposite Pickering Close. Our house at 1 Orchard Rd literally shakes when buses or waste disposal vehicles hit the pothole. I am concerned about damage to our house fabric.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Work putting in pavements on A435 alongside the new building site at Nortenham Allotments has been completed fir many months but a long line of traffic cones are still on the main road for no apparent reason., 17th September
item.description:
Many traffic cones on road alongside the main road A435 which are not required as pavement works have been completed and entrance to the site is closed and no access needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Please reply to my email query, 17th September
item.description:
I sent a query in via your form 3/8/25 Web Reference: HCF004050 Enquiry Number: 11491640 And followed up on 7/9/25 Web Reference: HCF004522 Enquiry Number: 11493833 I have heard nothing back. The speed bump here is insufficient as large vehicles do not slow down causing houses on the end of the street to rattle due to speed. Can you increase the size of this speed bump or implement more measure to slow traffic down. I think more calming measures or expansion of the speed bump would help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 117, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Street light mot working 3 wendercliff road, 17th September
item.description:
To the right of 3 wendercliff road that lights the alleyway to my back gate at 10 & 12 gorse road been like it a few days. I use the alleyway to get out my house and now it's getting dark and there is a big bush blocking the alleyway it's hard to see and there is a danger of falling in the dark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Wendercliff Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
